title: Electioneers Vs Dealers: How Boris Johnson's Government divides on what to do next over Brexit
text:
While ministers wait to see whether the European Union will offer the UK an extension to next Thursday's Brexit deadline, a split has opened up over whether Boris Johnson should push for a snap general election - or secure the safe passage of his exit deal through Parliament. Here we look at who is in which camp.

Electioneers

Vote Leave campaigners in 10 Downing St

Who? Dominic Cummings, joint chief of staff, and advisers Lee Cain, Robert Oxley, Chloe Westley

Argument: A general election during the Brexit extension period is the Prime Minister's best chance of securing a healthy majority for the next five years, and then taking the UK out of the EU.

'Go for it' Cabinet ministers

Sajid Javid,...
description: While ministers wait to see whether the European Union will offer the UK an extension to next Thursday's Brexit deadline, a split has opened up over whether Boris Johnson should push for a snap general election - or secure the safe passage of his exit deal through Parliament.
